article_title: Living on the Edge of Putin’s Menace
article_text:
Vilnius, Lithuania

Lithuanian workers last week began dismantling the last four Soviet statues standing in this Baltic state’s capital—which since the fall of the Soviet Union in 1991 has been transformed from a depressed East European backwater into a beacon of democracy and free markets.

The glorified monuments to Soviet students,...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Allysia Finley writes on how Lithuania is living on the edge of Vladimir Putin’s menace.
twitter.creator: @AllysiaFinley
